zadal.title: Zadal
zadal.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. [b]Zadal Reliquet Ultimum[/b] (Vin. 7, 1368 SA - Vor. 12, 1546 SA) was the Royal Prince of Old Lydia (1368 - 1410), High King of Old Lydia (1410 - 1412), reformer of the Lydian Kingdom, and founder of GLAIVE.
2. A rare male given name of Lydian origin.
zadal.origin: Masculine personal name - from ancient Dragolex, literally "crimson".
zadal.example: 1. [b]Zadal Reliquet Ultimum[/b], High King of Old Lydia

melio.title: Melio
melio.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. (15 SA - 1410 SA) A soldier of Old Lydia that specializes in a singular element or a fused element.
2. (1410 SA - present) A soldier of Lydia that specializes in a singular element or a fused element.
3. The distinctive title of a Melio soldier of Old Lydia (15 SA - 1410 SA) 
4. The distinctive title of a Melio soldier of Lydia (1410 SA - present)
melio.example:
1. [b]Melio Ignis Ardor[/b], the Melio of Fire
2. [b]Melio Aqua Unda[/b], the Melio of Water

abelite.title: Abelite
abelite.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. A semi-rare, onyx-colored metal used in forging to alter the color of an alloy. Generally found in the northern parts of Niguard and other sandy areas.
abelite.origin: Named from discoverer, Abel Jolefson. -ite from proto-lasil ayte "metal"
abelite.example: 1. [b]Abelite[/b] was used in the creation of the Niguardian Longsword.

aeth.title: Aeth
aeth.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. The fourth month of the year, containing 42 days. [i]Abbreviation:[/i] Aet.
aeth.origin: From Aether, god of balance and the atmosphere. Added to the Keyonian Calendar during the reign of Keyon. (77415 FA)
aeth.example: 1. [b]Aeth[/b] is the fourth month of the year.

aether.title: Aether
aether.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. God of the atmosphere and balance; currently dormant.
aether.origin: Discovered from ancient texts. True origin unknown.
aether.example: 1. [b]Aether[/b], the god of balance, is worshipped by followers of Azurity.

aguar.title: Aguar
aguar.definition:
[i][b]noun[/b][/i]
1. God of the atmosphere and balance; currently dormant.
aguar.origin: Discovered from ancient texts. True origin unknown.
